group.affects-element: TAN-T TEI TAN-A-div TAN-A-tok TAN-A-lm TAN-key TAN-mor

warning.rule: Users should be warned about versions of TAN that are under development.
warning.message: This version of TAN is under development, and is subject to change. Participants in developing the TAN schemas, functions, and guidelines are welcome. See http://textalign.net for details.

warning.rule: Users should be warned about versions of TAN that are semi-stable.
warning.message: This version of TAN is semi-stable. RELAX-NG schemas will be changed only to correct egregious errors. Other files might be edited, but most efforts on improvement will be spent on future versions.

error.rule: Files that point to older versions of TAN rules will be pointed to conversion stylesheets.

Every TAN file must have a primary agent, the organization or person that takes the greatest responsibility for the content of the TAN file. The primary agent is defined as the first <agent> with an <IRI> that is a tag URI whose namespace matches the namespaces of @id in the root element.
Any TAN file marked as being no longer in progress should have at least one master-location.
@xml:id values may not be repeated in the same document.
@href must have <location> or <master-location> as a parent; any other parent will trigger a quick fix to populate the element with the IRI + name pattern of the target file.

warning.rule: If fn:doc-available() for an @href returns false, the following message will be returned.
warning.message: @href points to file that is either (1) not available, (2) not valid XML, or (3) at a server not trusted by the validation engine.

error.rule: The only @href in a TAN document that may point to the same document id is that of <master-location>
No @href should point to the URI of the document itself.
An IRI may appear no more than once in a TAN document.
An IRI that names a TAN file must match that file's @id exactly.

Any IRI beginning urn: must continue with a name that is part of the official IANA Registry of URN Namespaces. See RFC 2414, https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8141, and https://www.iana.org/assignments/urn-namespaces/urn-namespaces.xhtml
No file may import keys that have duplicate IRIs.
All text must be normalized (Unicode NFC).

group.affects-attribute: who ed-who roles src lexicon morphology reuse-type bitext-relation feature include

error.rule: Every idref in an attribute must point to the @xml:id value of the appropriate corresponding element.
All idrefs in an attribute must be unique.
Attributes that take a regular expression must use escape sequences recognized by XML schema or TAN escape extensions (\u{}). See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#regexs
An <alias> may not mix idrefs from different elements.
<alias> references must not be circular.
No <master-location> may have an @href that points to a compressed archive.

warning.rule: Files should match the version kept at <master-location>.

error.rule: Any <see-also> whose <relationship> is defined as requiring a target TAN file must point to a file whose root element is a TAN file.
Any <see-also> whose <relationship> is defined as requiring a target copy must point to a TAN file whose root element is identical.
<see-also> may have the <relationship> of a different work version only if both are class 1 files and both share the same work.
For any element with @include, at least one element of the same name must be found in target inclusion document.
Inclusions may not be circular.

fatal.rule: Inclusions are integral parts of any TAN file. Access to at least one copy is absolutely mandatory.

error.rule: Every element with a <location> should have at least one document available.
Every TAN file referred to by way of an element containing <location> should have an @id that matches the <IRI> of the parent of the <location>
No element may point to a TAN file that has an identical @id value; the only exception is a <see-also> pointing to an older or new version.

warning.rule: If a target file does not explicitly give the <body>'s @in-progress the value of true() a warning will be returned.
warning.message: Target file is marked as being in progress.

warning.rule: If a target file has a <see-also> marked as a new version (update) a warning will be returned.
If @when-accessed predates one or more dates in a target file, a warning will be returned.

error.rule: Date attributes must be castable either as xs:dateTime or xs:date
Future dates are not permitted.
@from must predate @to
An element's @which must have a value that corresponds to a <name>, either in the core TAN keyword or an associated TAN-key file, that is marked as applying to that element.
Keywords (values of @which) must be unique for a given element name.
Any element that takes @which must have keywords defined for that element.

fatal.rule: Keys are integral parts of a document. Access to at least one version is absolutely mandatory.

error.rule: Sequences may not include values less than 1.
Sequences may not include values greater than the maximum allowed.
Ranges in sequences must go from a lesser value to a greater.
Class 1 files must share the same source as any alternatively divided edition.
Class 1 files must share the same work as any model or alternatively divided edition.
Class 1 files must share the same work-version, if supplied, as any alternatively divided edition.
Class 1 files must have identical transcriptions, after TAN normalization, as any alternatively divided edition.
A class 1 file may have no more than one model.

warning.rule: If a class 1 file diverges from the structure of its model a warning will be generated specifying where differences exist.

error.rule: A work element may invoke no more than one inclusion.
Leaf div references must be unique.
An @n taking digit values should not begin with 0.
Every leaf div must have at least some non-space text.
No text may begin with a modifying character.
No text may have a spacing character followed by a modifying character.
No text may have Unicode characters that are disallowed, e.g., U+A0, NO BREAK SPACE.
<div>s may not be mixed with other elements: a <div> must parent either only <div>s or none at all, and may have as siblings only other <div>s.
A <div> must not mix @include with any other attributes.
A <div> must have either @type + @n or @include but not both.

warning.rule: @n suffices for labeling text in a <div>; the @n's value should not appear in the text.
concatenated @n's suffice for labeling text in a <div>; the <div>'s reference should not appear in the text.
Text that represents a line, column, or page break should be moved into a @rend within a <lb>, <pb>, or <cb>.

error.rule: A breaking element without @break="no" should have at least one space on either side; one with @break="no" should have no nearby spaces
Every part of a @ref must correspond to a <div> in every source.

warning.rule: If a reference to a work is not found in some sources, a warning will be returned.

error.rule: Every token must be locatable in every cited ref in every source.
<tok> must reference a leaf <div>.
Every character must be locatable in every token in every ref in every source.
Ranges consist of exactly two values separated by a hyphen.
When renaming references, ranges must be predictably calculated.
At least one instance of an @n value should be found in each source.
@by may be applied only to those @n and @ref values that are calculable as integers.
In a <rename>, the number of values in @ref and @new must be identical.

warning.rule: If more than one <skip> applies to a <div> only the first will be applied.

fatal.rule: Sources are integral parts of a class 2 TAN file. Access to at least one copy is absolutely mandatory.

error.rule: No source may be given more than one token definition.
Every div type reference must be valid in every source
@new may not take the same value as what it replaces.

warning.rule: Only the first of multiple <rename>s that apply to a particular <div> will be applied.
Only the first of multiple <reassign>s that apply to a particular token will be applied.
If a <div> is renamed, and the target reference is subject to <reassign> instructions, the following message will appear.
warning.message: <reassign> targets a reference that has been altered by <rename>. Any reassignments will treat the newly created <div>, not the original.

error.rule: No alter action should result in the mixing of leaf <div>s and non-leaf <div>s.

group.affects-element: tok ana align reassign subject object locus

warning.rule: No <tok> should duplicate any sibling <tok>.

error.rule: In a ranged <tok> in a <reassign>, the token referred to by <from> must precede the one referred to by <to>.
Claims involving verbs whose object is constrained must use <object>, not @object.
Verbs that have object constraints must not be combined with other verbs in @verb.
<object>s taking strings must match the predefined @object-datatype for the verb.
<object>s taking strings for verbs that have lexical constraints must match those lexical constraints.
Every <claim> must have at least one subject, either @subject (self or ancestral <body>) or a child <subject>
Any predefined strictures on verbs must be respected.
Every <claim> must have at least one verb, either @verb (self or ancestral <body>)
<for-lang> and <source> are mutually exclusive in a TAN-A-lm file.
When using a category-based morphology, the number of feature codes in an <m> may not exceed the number of categories.
Every feature code in an <m> must be found in the target morphology file.
Every condition of a relevant dependency morphology <assert> (<report>) must be true (false) otherwise an error will be returned.
Names may not duplicate reserved TAN keyword names for the affected element.
Names may not be duplicates of, case-variants of, or hyphen variants of other names for the same element.
@affects-element must include only names of TAN elements that accept @which
Every item in a reserved TAN-key must have at least one IRI with a tag URN in the TAN namespace
Id values for features must be case-indifferently unique within a given category.
Every @href in a catalog.tan.xml file must point to a document that is available.

warning.rule: @href values in catalog.tan.xml should be unique

error.rule: @root should match the target's root element name
In a catalog.tan.xml, @id should match the target's root element @id

warning.rule: Different TAN files should have unique @ids.
If a local catalog.tan.xml file lacks a reference to a TAN file being validated, a warning will appear.
A TAN file being validated verbosely will include errors reported in any local catalog.tan.xml

error.rule: Token-based assertions of multiple class 2 TAN documents that share the same class 1 source may be compared or collated only if those class 2 documents adopt identical token definitions.
Assertions of multiple TAN-A-div documents that share the same class 1 source may be compared or collated only if they suppress, or fail to suppress, the same div types.
Mismatched sets of statistics may not be merged.
